results.title: Argentina
results.brief_description: Buenos Aires is the commercial, industrial, and financial centre of Argentina; the inland pampas region is the source of Argentina’s wealth. The interdependence of the city and the agricultural area is emphasised.

results.title: Aren't they wonderful
results.brief_description: Newsreel type presentation pf a Scottish gun dog training school; what happens when you dial the police emergency number; and a performance by Felix Mendelssohn and his Hawaiian Serenaders in Sophisticated Hula. Series is Pathe Pictorial.

results.title: Area theorems
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Donald Batchelor
results.brief_description: Using animated shapes and the manipulation of models (translation and rotation) the facts concerning the area of the triangle, parallelogram and trapezium are demonstrated. An episode from the series “Vision in Mathematics”. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area schools of Tasmania
results.brief_description: The first scene of this film shows some attractive views of rural scenery in Tasmania. It is perhaps easier to make rural life in Tasmania attractive than in some of the other Australian states, for Tasmania has been blessed with many rural scenes of great beauty. Most of these shots were taken in the Huon Valley; the camera then lingers on an Area School at Huonville. There must be, however, in all the other Australian states many attractive rural districts which would provide a suitable environment for an Area school. Tasmania has many attractive one-teacher schools. The school shown is situated at Longley in the mountain district behind Mount Wellington. Since the introduction of the first Area school, however, the number of small rural schools in Tasmania has been diminished by about one hundred.

results.title: Area III: Barbara finds the formula
results.brief_description: A girl explores an imaginary place called Arealand where she learns the formula for the area of a rectangle: A = L x W, and meets the hectare and the square kilometre. No other credits available. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area II: Barbara searches the squares
results.brief_description: A girl explores an imaginary place called Arealand where she learns about the use of squares in metric measurment. Demonstrates how to determine area either by counting squares of by multiplying columns by rows. No other credits availabe. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area 1: Barbara arrives in Arealand
results.creator_credit: South Carolina TV Network and Agency for Instructional Television
results.brief_description: In a journey “through her window” Barbara ventures into Arealand for the three programs in the MeasureArea cluster. She explores the concept of area and discovers a variety of ways to determine it with trhe help of many unusual fantasyland characters. In this program Barbara learns that area is two-dimensional and that “covering” is a process to determine area. She encounters square metre, square decimetre and square centimetre. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Are you safe at home?
results.creator_credit: Peter Cock, Crawley Films and George Gorman
results.brief_description: Intelligent methods of preventing fire and of fighting it should it break out. Simple home fire rules are suggested, and types of fire extinguishers suitable for the home are displayed. We see how a family that is well-organised and keeps cool escapes from a burning house and manages to save the building and most of its contents. The graphic story of a man caught in a strange hotel room with both exits barred by flames, shows how even in this desperate predicament knowledge and cool-headedness can avert final disaster. (Award: Chicago)

results.title: Are you ready for sex?
results.creator_credit: Henry Mayer, Mayer Espar Productions and Sheri Gillette Espar
results.brief_description: Through dramatization and student discussions, questions concerning sexual responsibility, inter-personal communication, peer group pressure, sexual maturity, personal values, sexual intercourse, the use of contraceptives and sexual abstinence are examined. The discussion has an American cultural bias. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.
